bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Attempting to download/watch a Twitch.tv video with youtube-dl fails.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
youtube-dl-2016.07.17-1.fc24.noarch
How reproducible:
Always
Steps to Reproduce:
Run youtube-dl with any options with a Twitch.tv URL
Actual results:
ERROR: Unable to download JSON metadata: HTTP Error 400: Bad Request (caused by <HTTPError 400: 'Bad Request'>)
Expected results:
It works.
Additional info:
Fix is already available in youtube-dl 2016.09.15.
youtube-dl-2016.09.15-1.el7 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2016-ff7b8b7ce5
youtube-dl-2016.09.15-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-3bac0fac1a
youtube-dl-2016.09.15-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-360febf527
youtube-dl-2016.09.15-1.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-1b9586d863
youtube-dl-2016.09.15-1.el6 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 6. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2016-61092d1efb

youtube-dl-2016.09.15-1.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2016-ff7b8b7ce5
